items.title: OnePlus Turbo is now rumored to get a global launch
items.summary: Next month OnePlus is unveiling a new series in China called Turbo, which will debut with two devices. One of these was spotted in the Geekbench database yesterday rocking the Snapdragon 8s Gen 4 SoC. According to a new rumor, this device will get an international launch as well, including in Indiaâ€¦

items.title: Trump administration bars former EU official and anti-disinformation and hate researchers from US
items.summary: Thierry Breton, former EU Commissioner for Internal Market and Services, speaks at the event "Economic Transformation, Net-Zero Valley and Digitalization" in May 2024. On Tuesday, the Trump Administration followed through on a threat of retaliation targeting foreigners who are involved in content mâ€¦

items.title: Samsung teases The First Look 2026 CES launch event for TVs, monitors, appliances
items.summary: Samsung is getting ready for CES, which takes place in Las Vegas from January 6 to January 9. The company will use the trade show to unveil new TVs, monitors, and home appliances. Samsung's CES unveiling event is called The First Look, and you can see the teaser (trailer?) for it embedded below. Thâ€¦

items.summary: Hyun Bin and Jung Woo-sung go head-to-head in â€œMade in Korea,â€ a 1970s crime noir that launches Dec. 24 on Disney+ with a two-episode premiere. The series stars Hyun Bin (â€œCrash Landing on You,â€ â€œConfidential Assignmentâ€) as Baek Kitae, an ambitious KCIA agent in 1970s South Korea who leads a dangeâ€¦

items.title: Koepka becomes first major winner to leave LIV Golf
items.summary: Five-time major champion Brooks Koepka leaves LIV Golf to prioritise "the needs of his family".

The 45-minute special featured new interviews with the late filmmakerâ€™s friends, including Katâ€¦

items.title: Man City in advanced talks with Bournemouth's Semenyo
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo is set to make a final decision on his future with Manchester City in advanced talks over a January move for the Bournemouth forward.

items.title: Hood beats Noppert in epic as more seeds tumble
items.summary: World number 86 Justin Hood wins an Alexandra Palace classic against Danny Noppert, who is one of three seeds to exit the World Championship on Tuesday.

items.title: Xiaomi Watch 5 is coming this week with an EMG sensor and the Snapdragon W5 SoC
items.summary: The Xiaomi 17 Ultra will be unveiled on December 25, and it will be joined by the Xiaomi Watch 5. This new wearable will be Xiaomi's highest-end yet, featuring a stainless steel case and a sapphire crystal on top of its screen - both standard materials for high-end analog watches. The Xiaomi Watch â€¦

items.title: Samsung’s 2026 gaming monitors promise 6K, 3D, and up to 1,040Hz
items.summary: Samsung is breaking new ground with its 2026 lineup of gaming monitors, with the Odyssey 3D G90XH becoming the first to feature a 6K display with "glasses-free 3D." The new monitor comes with a 32-inch IPS panel, offering real-time eye-tracking that "adjusts depth and perspective" based on your posâ€¦

items.title: Norwegian biathlete Bakken dies aged 27
items.summary: Norwegian biathlete Sivert Guttorm Bakken, who had been hoping to compete at the Winter Olympics in February, dies aged 27.

items.title: 007 First Light’s release date gets shaken up
items.summary: IO Interactive has delayed the release of 007 First Light, its upcoming James Bond origin story game, by two months. 007 First Light will now be released on May 27th, 2026. According to an announcement about the delay: 007 First Light is our most ambitious project to date, and the team has been fulâ€¦

items.title: Oppo Pad Air5 gets unboxed ahead of its full unveiling
items.summary: Oppo is making the Pad Air5 official on December 25, and ahead of that, today the company has published a quick official unboxing of the upcoming device. This shows the tablet in all its glory in the Starlight Pink colorway (it will also be offered in Space Grey), along with the 45W wired charger tâ€¦

items.title: Japanese shops halt desktop PC orders until 2026 as memory shortage intensifies â€” built-to-order systems hamstrung by component shortages and skyrocketing prices
items.summary: Japanese PC shops have temporarily halted sales on BTO (built-to-order) computers, citing difficulties in keeping up with demand. Worldwide component shortages have not only made prices skyrocket, but they fluctuate so much that it's useless to offer quotes to customers where inventories are dryingâ€¦

items.title: These great digital gifts will arrive just in time for Christmas
items.summary: Tune in for a holiday viewing of KPop Demon Hunters on Netflix. And just like that, Christmas is less than two days away, which is too soon for most items bought online to arrive in time. That said, you arenâ€™t alone if you waited too long to start buying gifts this year, and you definitely arenâ€™t aâ€¦

items.title: 'Top-class' Gordon commits to Scotland return
items.summary: Blaze captain Kirstie Gordon opts to add to her 60 Scotland caps more than eight years on from a switch to England.

items.title: ASRock X870 Taichi Creator Review: A Taichi for Creatives
items.summary: ASRockâ€™s X870 Taichi Creator is a good, sub-$320 AM5 motherboard. items.title: 'I don't mind them having a Christmas dinner' - Dyche on weighing players
items.summary: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche urges his players to show "common sense" over Christmas after Pep Guardiola says he will weigh his squad on their return.

items.title: Ainslie secures investment for  America's Cup team
items.summary: Britain's Ben Ainslie says private equity funding will help Athena Racing challenge for the America's Cup in 2027.

items.title: Slot frustrated as Liverpool set to lose Isak for 'long time'
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he expects to lose Alexander Isak for "a couple of months" after the striker was injured in a tackle by Tottenham's Micky van de Ven - a challenge that Slot has called "reckless".

items.title: Dev uses ePaper tablet as a secondary display to save his eyes â€” gives second life to old Onyx Boox Air 2 by mirroring laptop screen

items.title: How England lost the Ashes in five charts

items.title: OnePlus Turboâ€™s AnTuTu score emerges

Just yesterday, the OnePlus Turbo appeared in a Geekbench listing which revealed it to be running on Qualcommâ€™s Snapdragon 8s Gen 4 chipsâ€¦

items.title: Corsair ships customer $35 decorative memory sticks instead of $1,000 worth of 96 GB of DDR5 memory â€” buyer accidentally receives dummy RAM in unlucky warranty claim
items.summary: In an extremely timely mix-up, someone on the r/pcmasterrace subreddit sent one of the sticks in their 96 GB kit of Corsair's Vengeance DDR5 for an RMA and received non-functional dummy RAM in return. Customer's real memory was worth at least $1000 while the decorative modules are just $35.

items.title: I'm not retiring, I'm evolving - Kipchoge
items.summary: The Kenyan marathoner has all the running accolades he needs but is now focusing on new goals.

items.title: Indonesia bowler takes five wickets in over
items.summary: Indonesia seamer Gede Priandana becomes the first bowler to take five wickets in an over in a T20 international, returning figures of 5-1 against Cambodia.

items.title: Purdy keeps alive 49ers title push in win over Colts
items.summary: Quarterback Brock Purdy throws a career-high five touchdown passes as San Francisco 49ers win 48-27 against Indianapolis Colts to keep alive their NFC West title hopes.

items.title: US smart home company accused of rebranding footage-leaking Chinese cameras â€” Nebraska AG to sue Resideo over selling banned security cameras
items.summary: Resideo sued by Nebraska AG over rebranding footage-leaking Chinese cameras

items.title: Key sorry for '20%' England in Ashes
items.summary: Director of cricket Rob Key apologises to fans for England's miserable Ashes tour, but says captain Ben Stokes and Brendon McCullum have his backing.

items.title: Newcastle seek 'clarification' over non-penalty
items.summary: Manager Eddie Howe says Newcastle "want to know the thought process behind the decision" not to award them a penalty against Chelsea on Saturday.
